decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly ramping up land cards to trigger Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle's ability to deal damage to the opponent. Through cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, the player can search for and play multiple Valakut triggers in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with direct damage. Cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek help accelerate the land ramping process, while spells like Lightning Bolt provide additional removal and reach. The deck's goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Liliana of the Veil, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a quick clock. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, allowing for consistent access to all the necessary colors of mana. This Aggro - Jund deck is designed to be proactive, efficient, and versatile in disrupting and attacking the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to slow down opponent's game plan through disruption and removal spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, Terminate, and Fatal Push, while generating value and board presence with cards like Snapcaster Mage, Young Pyromancer, and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck aims to control the game by out-valuing the opponent and utilizing versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command, to maintain board dominance and finish off the opponent with efficient removal spells and powerful threats. This deck excels at grinding out games and outmaneuvering opponents in a prolonged match.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed for the Ad Nauseam win condition. It uses cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to ramp up mana, while Angel's Grace, Phyrexian Unlife, and Ad Nauseam are used to draw and play out the entire deck in one turn. Pact of Negation provides protection, while Spoils of the Vault helps to search for key combo pieces. The deck also includes a back-up win condition with Lightning Storm and Laboratory Maniac. The goal is to win the game in one explosive turn before the opponent can disrupt the combo.

The deck focuses on playing fast and aggressively with a strong human tribal theme. It aims to establish a board presence quickly by using cards like Noble Hierarch and Champion of the Parish to accelerate mana and pump up creatures. Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt opponents' strategies while Mantis Rider and Kessig Malcontents deal damage efficiently. The deck's mix of disruption, aggression, and synergy between cards like Aether Vial and Thalia's Lieutenant makes it difficult for opponents to stabilize or respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through spells like Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose, while also being able to dig through the deck for key pieces with cards like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand. Once the combo pieces are assembled, the deck aims to cast multiple spells in a single turn using cost reduction creatures like Baral and Goblin Electromancer to build up to a lethal Grapeshot. The deck also features tools like Past in Flames and Gifts Ungiven to help recur key cards and find answers as needed.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of artifact creatures and buffing them with equipment like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. Utilizing mana accelerants like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly build a threatening board presence and close out games with a combination of evasive threats and burn spells like Galvanic Blast.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Obligator. The ramp from cards like Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple allows for early plays, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Dismember help maintain control of the board. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Batterskull. The mana base is designed to support the Eldrazi creatures while providing consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on quickly draining the opponent's resources through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and high-value threats. By disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also efficiently removing threats with cards like Terminate and Lightning Bolt, this deck aims to control the game early on. The deck then transitions into a more aggressive strategy by utilizing cards like Young Pyromancer and Bedlam Reveler to close out the game quickly.

This Jund deck aims to overwhelm and outpace opponents through a blend of aggressive creatures, disruption spells, and versatile removal. By efficiently deploying threats like Tarmogoyf, Bloodbraid Elf, and Dark Confidant alongside powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil, the deck looks to apply consistent pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. With a strong mana base and a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, this deck aims to stay ahead of the curve and control the battlefield.

The main concept of this Gruul Utopia Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's mana base and game plan by utilizing land destruction spells like Molten Rain and Stone Rain, combined with Blood Moon to lock down non-basic lands. The deck aims to ramp up quickly with Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl, while also generating value and card advantage with cards like Bloodbraid Elf, Tireless Tracker, and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar. The finishers in the deck include powerful threats like Inferno Titan and Pia and Kiran Nalaar, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt for additional reach.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and utilizing various artifacts to pump them up and deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy involves using cards like Mox Opal and Cranial Plating to power up creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest, while also protecting them with cards like Welding Jar. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive board presence, while also having the ability to close out games with cards like Galvanic Blast and Inkmoth Nexus.

The deck revolves around maximizing mana and card draw using artifacts like Mox Opal, Ancient Stirrings, and Terrarion to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Scrap Trawler, Myr Retriever, and Krark-Clan Ironworks. This allows for infinite loops of sacrificing artifacts for mana and card draw, eventually leading to a win condition such as Aetherflux Reservoir. The deck also includes utility lands like Inventors' Fair and Buried Ruin to recur key pieces and ensure consistency in executing the combo. Additionally, cards like Engineered Explosives provide a way to control the board and protect the combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Tidehollow Sculler, Thought-Knot Seer, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to strip away their key cards and slow them down. This is combined with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Eldrazi Displacer to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Wasteland Strangler, while Aether Vial provides additional flexibility and tempo advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game while still maintaining a fast-paced aggro strategy.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and graveyard with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Relic of Progenitus, while also applying pressure with efficient creature threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Wasteland Strangler. The deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options while dealing damage quickly with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Tidehollow Sculler. The deck utilizes a mix of hand disruption, graveyard hate, and powerful Eldrazi threats to maintain a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and assemble the Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle combo with Primeval Titan. By fetching Valakut and a few Mountains with Primeval Titan's ability, the deck can deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn. Cards like Through the Breach allow for explosive plays, while Search for Tomorrow and Explore help to accelerate mana development. The deck aims to win the game in a single turn by overwhelming the opponent with massive amounts of direct damage.
